job_title: Supplemental Instructor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Good job for student, flexible hours, independence and freedom for recitation, great for gaining teaching experience.
cons: Not many, you'll have to attend course lectures for a class you already know the content of. For me this.was good, for others maybe not.

job_title: Director in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Benefits are good for the industry, 401k matching was highest percentage I've ever seen
cons: Faculty and staff both have unions and contracts, admin has nothing. Pay bump for the move to admin is not nearly enough for the stress of knowing that they can drop you anytime to save $$$$

job_title: Processing Specialist in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Supportive and friendly work environment on a mission-minded team.
cons: Salary was good for the job, not great for the area.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Blue Bell, PA
pros: They have great pay and benefits
cons: Lack of care for employees

job_title: Enrollment Services Assistant in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Tuition waiver, benefits, summer hours.
cons: Lack of organization, responsibility, and training.

job_title: Director of Libraries in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Enjoyable colleagues, flexible work, nice benefits package, good tuition benefits at local and online schools if you are planning to expand your education.
cons: No bonuses ever, annual pay increases aren't enough to cover cost of living even for Union members, most people move on within 5 years.

job_title: Enrolment Services in Pottstown, PA
pros:
I had a fantastic time working as an Enrollment Services Casual. 
The staff treated everyone with respect and wanted you to succeed.
Flexible hours, positive team environment.
Fantastic academic institute, driven by people who truly care about the students.
cons:
Low pay.
Due to working part-time, you get no insurance.
No paid time off for part-time workers.

review_title: Pretty good if you don't care about work-life balance
job_title: Network Security Engineer in Blue Bell, PA
pros:
Caring, friendly colleagues
Students-first mindset
Typically a fun place to work
Benefits are excellent (medical, retirement)
Generally more cutting-edge technology-wise which is cool
cons:
Minimal work-life balance
Zero schedule flexibility for regular day hours, but expected to be on-call 24/7
No comp time for after-hours work
No room for advancement/growth (in-part due to small organization size)

review_title: Nice Environment No Paid Time Off
job_title: Administrative in Blue Bell, PA
pros: MCCC offers a dynamic working environment and discounts on all courses. Part time workers can participate in the retirement plan.
cons: No paid time off for part time workers. Most career opportunities stongly prefer a masters degree.

job_title: Music Teacher in Newtown Square, PA
pros: Flexible schedule and nice campus
cons: Uncertainty about classes filling and running

job_title: Assistant Director in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Benefits, time off, Felix ability
cons: Pay, leadership, commute, politics, office environment

job_title: Manager of Public Grants in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Wonderful academic institute, driven by people who truly care about the students.
cons: Segregated departments with toxic cultural politics; fear of retribution from leadership; close-minded to solutions presented.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Blue Bell, PA
pros: My colleagues were great; a lot of fun to work with and very supportive.
cons: Interdepartmental communication was a struggle. Often departemnts were implementing different policies/rules for handling the same situation, so students would be confused as to what steps they needed to take to register for classes or pay their tuition, and those of us in our respective offices would be likewise confused becasue we're providing information that is good for our office, but was conflicting with how things were done in another office.

job_title: Enrollment Support Representative in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Got appropriate amount of training, good work hours.
cons: Students/People who called were rude and lazy, refused to do what we asked them to do.

review_title: Decent Benefits (if you can get them), but immature work environment
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Pottstown, PA
pros: You can take classes for free (aside from taxes and textbooks)
cons:
My boss was inept and she gossiped about me to her boss, who in turned treated me poorly. It just feels like high school.
I had to do an event with the Marketing department. The woman leading the event didn't see that I signed up for a specific position, gave me a hard time time because SHE didn't see it, and then was totally petty about it and gave me a spot in the worst possible place that didn't make sense for my program. 
There are a ton of cliques here and it's probably a better place for you to work if you're black because you'd better fit with their cliques.
It's also really hard to get a full time spot with benefits.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: well organized administration, good feedback and coverage for dealing with the pandemic
cons: not a lot of opportunity for growth or full time instructor/teaching postions

job_title: Academic Advisor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Co workers were great and support you; however, management does not
cons: worked as an adjunct and an advisor and was stuck in part time in both with no opportunities for full time that opened up

job_title: Enrollment Specialist in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Staff is friendly. Student-focused; great retirement matching
cons: No flexibility; late hours; focus is students not employeees

review_title: The students are great and are eager to learn with aspirations of a 4 year college or work.
job_title: Instructor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: The campus is beautiful and has plenty of parking. The staff (security, cleaning, etc.) are very congenial and helpful.  There is a conference room for adjuncts and the copier is easily accessible.  The students appreciate good teaching and rise to the occasion.
cons: There is inconsistency in classroom space with some being state-of-the-art and others with no technology, in the same building. The composition requirement of having three readers for papers marked by different full time faculty is ridiculous--everyone is reading for different things and grading that does not coincide with classroom lectures.  It's frustrating to the teacher and students.

review_title: No room to grow and wages are not the best
job_title: Student Services Assistant in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Benefits are under $100/mo for a family. Lot of downtime, usually not micromanaged, time off, some administrators can be very supportive
cons:
No promotional opportunities, so unless you are a favorite you are stuck in the same job for 15 years. Wages are horribly stagnant, so expect to earn .50 cent a year extra.

Too many administrators and not enough people doing the work. People leave left and right because they can't move up and they are not replaced. Nepotism, cronisim and some racism is painfully obvious throughout the college. Underqualified people are hired left and right just to present the right "image"

review_title: Great Benefits & Pay for Field- Pathetic Culture
job_title: Enrollment in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Salary, Benefits & Paid time off were all great; however, that was the extent of anything positive within this institution.
cons: Disorganized from the President's office down- there's a reason he didn't renew his contract. Too many people in director-level roles and not enough people actually doing work. Incompetent management and toxic work environment.. Unless you're in a tenure position or are incompetent.. you will not enjoy your time here. This was my 4th college employer and by far the worst employment experience in my career.

review_title: As a faculty member for over 15 years, MCCC has proven to be a place of strong values, great resources.
job_title: Professor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: The resources available for faculty to pursue new technologies, grant funding and entrepreneurial ideas are incredibly strong for a community college. Benefits are outstanding; salaries less so but in alignment with competing institutions.
cons: For students, the range of experience they may have is incredibly varied - faculty experiences are as well. Seeking out the best and most motivated/talented people on campus will provide you with a very rewarding professional life. Just isolating to a specific department and their politics may lead to dissatisfaction.

review_title: Montgomery County Community College is a rewarding work enviroment.
job_title: in Blue Bell, PA
pros: The best part of working for Montgomery County Community College is the satisfaction and validations of your hard work when a student visits, and tells you how proud they are of a good test grade, or passing a course.
cons: Many of the students don't care, or don't try.  It is the age old question of ignorance, or apathy.  To compound the problem, there are many student who try really hard, but have a learning disability, and most employees are not trained to handle these students.

job_title: Instructional Associate in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Benefits are excellent better than most area colleges and university. They even have paid professional  development leave for staff employed for a minimum of 3 years. This is similar to faculty sabbatical. There are 3 campuses so you can move to a different campus for work purposes as long as it is not to far from where you live.
cons: More unity and transportation between the 3 campuses needed.  Employees should be able to evaluate management not just the other way around. people tend to stay a long time which can be good if they are good employees and management but bad if they are problematic.

job_title: Adjunct in Austin, TX
pros: Friendly people all around, good pay for part-time teaching. A lot of freedom to teach, and there were never people who were influencing how you taught. I cannot be happier that I had the opportunity to work here.
cons: As with anywhere, some students can be tough. There are a lot who want to do as little work as possible, but still think that they should get a C in the class. Some had to learn the hard way that that will not work.

job_title: Tutor in Herndon, VA
pros: Students come to learn, we teach them. Some students try to learn, and they are a pleasure to work with. There is nothing better than watching another person get a difficult concept. (Watching the light go off so to speak.)
cons: Some students expect to not have to do any work at all. This is where the job breaks down. Management expects the student is never wrong so the teachers and tutors are second class citizens.

review_title: Great, innovative environment. Good people. Nice campus.
job_title: Faculty in Blue Bell, PA
pros: People are really nice. The students are motivated to learn. The administration is interested in continual improvement. They have a great and active faculty union, including for adjuncts. Compensation for faculty is good.
cons: State funding is an annual battle and there aren't many full-time faculty spots to try for if you are an adjunct. Some of the adjuncts are territorial and not too terribly professional to their fellow adjuncts.

job_title: Admissions in Havertown, PA
pros: The College recognizes and rewards hard work. You get out what you put into it. The benefits are superior to other institutions in the area
cons: You have to understand that the College serves Montgomery County and as with many community colleges, works to improve the welfare of the county. This is different from other institutions. THIS IS NOT A CON. But for those who are thinking about coming from another institution, you will have to quickly recognize this.

job_title: Professor of Health Enhancement in Germantown, MD
pros: Great students, diverse and intelligent.
cons: Excellent, diverse student body.  Full time professors get all of the benefits and all of the money.  Adjuncts, even the highest level of adjunct, Adjunct II, still does not make even 1/5th of what full timers are making who are teaching exactly the same courses and the same course load.

review_title: A sweatshop in Sri Lanka would be an improvement!
job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Benefits are very good even as compared to other community colleges.
cons:
Administrative employees work in a "sweatshop" atmosphere. Senior management has no ability to prioritize tasks and tries to get too many things accomplished with too few people. As expected, this haphazard approach to management results in all things being done poorly. 

Part-time faculty are not respected by the majority of full-time faculty even though most of the part-time faculty are much better instructors than many tenured full-time faculty.

review_title: If You Love Interacting One on One with Students, MC is the place!
job_title: Adjunct Professor II in Rockville, MD
pros:
Student to teacher ratio is very good--25-35/class
Atmosphere positive
Such Diversity and multi-cultural environment, I love!
Excellent Department Chair and good communication even to part time.
cons:
True everywhere, being an adjunct, part time-no benefits and about 1/3 the pay of full timers is the case. 
Another career or job is necessary to keep income appropriate for area.

job_title: CIS Adjunct Professor in Pottstown, PA
pros: Great and friendly coworkers. Terrific resources and technology to use in the classroom. Creativity and diversification of teaching methods is allowed. They paid for me to get certifications
cons: No real cons to discuss. The entrances do get bottled up with traffic on occasion due to too many stop signs and one lane streets

job_title: Professor in Blue Bell, PA
pros: The goal of the College's work is powerful and meaningful. Almost everyone there is committed to that as their priority.
cons: Economically education is in a challenging time so there are constant need to be creative with fewer resources.

job_title: Senior Lecturer in Pottstown, PA
pros: Montco has great faculty and staff that work together to make a great experience for students. Their educational technology is amazing and they are always willing to assist to expand that technology
cons: Sometimes students in remedial classes can be difficult.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Nice place to work.
cons: Process of hiring takes too long, loss of great experienced applicants due to favoritism, hiring system needs upgrading.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Ambler, PA
pros: Montco is a friendly and progressive environment.
cons: They wouldn't pay attention to the cries of employees that the director over our program was not qualified and running the program into the ground. Employee turn over is ridiculous.

job_title: Grants Manager in Blue Bell, PA
pros: People are great, the campus environment is friendly in general.
cons: The political nature of the organization makes it challenging to perform at the highest level.

job_title: Kickboxing Instructor in Montgomery, PA
pros: The HR was very nice, everybody was friendly, and every staff in the adult evening programs provided quality.
cons: The distance was very far form my house.

job_title: Administrator in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Summer hours, holidays and bad weather days off. Working with students.
cons: Career growth - difficult unless have Edd or PhD

job_title: Adjunct English Instructor in Pottstown, PA
pros: Fantastic facilities, helpful and friendly staff!
cons: I have yet to encounter a negative aspect to my position

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Pay is good compared to other colleges
cons:
Leadership is lacking- opportunity for advancement is based on your ability to infuriate certain clicks.
Claim to care about students but management doesn’t always seem to

job_title: in Blue Bell, PA
pros: Great staff and flexible hours
cons: There was no cons with this position

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Blue Bell, PA
pros: small school. small class size
cons: only option is part time

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Salford, PA
pros: Was a wonderful place for workplace environment and benefits. No longer.
cons: Complete lack of vision.  More work for less compensation.  I would give senior management a negative star rating if I could.
